sections.title: MBBS Admission in Gujarat 2024-25, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, cut-off and Counselling

content.content: Gujarat is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, Gujarat offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in Gujarat is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.

The MBBS curriculum in Gujarat spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.In Gujarat aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of MBBS seats in Gujarat can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. For MBBS Admission Gujarat 2024 total 7150 seats are available in Government and private Medical Colleges. The state has 1 AIIMS located at Nagpur and 23 Government and 17 Private Medical Colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of MBBS admission for the academic year 2024-25 in Gujarat including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. For personalized assistance with MBBS admission in India or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at MBBS APP.

Gujarat has a total of 40 Medical Colleges, including 23 Government Medical Colleges, 1 AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), 1 Deemed university and 17 Private Medical Colleges. The Government Medical Colleges offer 4250 MBBS seats, while the Private Medical colleges offer 2900 MBBS seats.

content.table:
Application modeOnline
Admission CriteriaNational Entrance Exam
Entrance ExamNational Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)
Examination AuthorityNational Testing Agency (NTA)
Total College Count40 (Including Govt & Private)
Number of SeatsMBBS- 7150 ((Including Govt & Private))
Admission ProcessThe admission process will be conducted through online counselling by the State Common Entrance Test Cell – Gujarat.
+91 80946-06060
Rounds of State CounsellingThere will be Four Rounds of Counselling for the state quota seats. The first round of counselling will be held in July 2023, the second round in August 2023, and the Third & Fourth Round in September 2023.
Selection CriteriaCandidates will be selected based on their NEET-UG score and the reservation criteria.
Top MBBS CollegesAIIMS Rajkot, B J Medical College Ahmedabad, GMERS Medical College Valsad, Medical College Baroda, Kiran Medical College Surat, Ananya College of Medicine & Research

content.content: Official Website: www.medadmgujarat.org

Medical Colleges (Include AIIMS & JIPMER) and 2900 seats are reserve for Private Medical Colleges.

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

sections.title: Application Form for Gujarat MBBS Admission 2024-25

content.list:
• The application form must be filled out entirely online. Only online application fees are accepted from students.
  • The MBBS Admission Gujarat Application Form is now available, and candidates can submit their applications till the deadline.
  • In order to register for the Gujarat MBBS 2024 application form, applicants must input their personal, academic, NEET 2024 score, and other information. The authority will announce the merit ranking and adhere to the procedure of document verification, choice-filling, and place-allocation.
  • Candidates must bring a hard copy of their admissions application along with all Original Documents when they report to the designated medical or dental college; otherwise, their application will be rejected/disqualified without further communication.

sections.title: Application Fees & Security Deposit for MBBS Admission Gujarat 2024-25

content.content: Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of Directorate of Medical Education & Research Gujarat during the registration window for each counselling round. Category wise application fee for Gujarat NEET UG Counselling is as follows:

content.table:
ParticularNon- refundable amountRefundable security deposit
Fee₹ 1,000/-₹ 11,000/-

content.content: The security deposit in Gujarat NEET UG Counselling serves various purposes. It ensures a fair, effective, and financially sustainable process for a larger range of qualified applicants by discouraging seat blocking, encouraging commitment and thwarting fraud. This financial commitment benefits everyone in the long run by preserving an open and trustworthy system for medical college admissions. Details of Security deposit is as follows: – Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of Directorate of Medical Education & Research Gujarat during the registration window for each counselling round. Category wise application fee for Gujarat NEET UG Counselling

sections.title: Application Process for MBBS Admission Gujarat

content.content: The Commissioner, State CET CELL, Gandhinagar will conduct the admission process for all the Health Science courses in the State of Gujarat. Online applications will be invited from eligible candidate(s) for admission to all Government/Corporation, Private & Minority Colleges. Online application form will be made available on website https://www.medadmgujarat.org/.

content.list:
• The candidate must be an Indian National.
  • The candidate must be registered with State CET cell, Gandhinagar through online application on website of State CET Cell.
  • Indian Citizen
  • Overseas Citizen of India (OCI) Candidate will be eligible for Government / Corporation / Government Aided / Private unaided college for academic year 2024-25.
  • Those who want to apply must have a 10+2 in the science stream from a recognized board.
  • Those who want to apply for Gujarat MBBS Admission must have taken Biology as a required course and have a minimum of 50% overall marks.
  • Those who want to apply must take the NEET Exam. From the 2023–24 academic year on, there is no upper age limit to take the NEET exam.

sections.title: Document Required for MBBS Admission Gujarat

content.list:
• Score Sheet for NEET 2023
  • NEET Admission Ticket
  • Letter of Assignment
  • 12th class card and passing certificate
  • Grade Card and Passing Certificate for Grade 10
  • All grade reports for classes 11 and 12, if they were passed in more than one attempt.
  • A copy of a photo identification card, such as a driver’s licence, PAN card, electoral card, government or public utility card, school ID card, or Aadhar card.
  • Valid caste certificate, sub-category certificate, if applicable
  • Certificate of domicile, if applicable
  • 4 passport size photographs same as affixed on application form
  • Character certification from the previous study institution
  • Migration Certificate from the previous study institution
  • The MBBS admission process in Gujarat is a competitive one, but it is also a fair one. All candidates who meet the eligibility criteria have a chance to be admitted to a medical college in the state.
